<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	C. Research and Development
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	D. Trend Information
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	E. Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F. Tabular Disclosure of Contractual
	Obligations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	G. Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates, and Recently issued Accounting Standards
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	A. Operating Results
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We are the largest cellular network operator in Japan with a total subscription of 70.96 million, which represented 45.3%
	of all cellular subscriptions in Japan as of March 31, 2016. We earn revenues and generate cash primarily by offering mobile communications services and mobile handset sales. In mobile communications services, which account for the majority of our
	revenues, we provide voice communication services as well as data communication services via our packet communications network. In addition to mobile communications services and mobile handset sales, we provide telecommunications services such as
	optical-fiber broadband services, satellite communications services and international services. To make &#147;Smart Life&#148; a reality, through our smart life business we provide services such as video and music distribution, electronic books and
	other services offered through our &#147;dmarket&#148; portal, finance/payment services, shopping services and various other services to support our customers&#146; daily lives. We also provide &#147;Mobile Device Protection Service,&#148;
	development, sales and maintenance of IT systems and others.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Japan&#146;s telecommunications sector has seen a dramatic
	change in its market structure due to the launch of services by a wide range of players following the start of &#147;Hikari Collaboration Model,&#148; which is a new wholesale business model for fiber access, the rapid proliferation of smartphones
	and tablet devices, developments related to the government&#146;s pro-competition policy (such as new market entry by Mobile Virtual Network Operators (&#147;MVNOs&#148;), the obligation to unlock handset SIMs and the proposals by the Ministry of
	Internal Affairs and Communications&#146; Task Force on Mobile Phone Rates and Other Conditions for Service Offerings) and other factors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Amid these changes in the market environment, we positioned the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 as the period to make a solid step forward towards the delivery of our medium-term targets, and we managed
	our business with a particular focus on our operating income target. To boost our telecommunications services revenues, we have added new options to the &#147;Kake-hodai &amp; Pake-aeru&#148; new billing plan, implemented various measures to expand
	the adoption of the &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; optical-fiber broadband service and continued our efforts to strengthen our communications network and offer attractive handsets. Meanwhile, we have also strived to add new services to our
	&#147;dmarket&#148; marketplace and enrich the content portfolio of our services in a bid to grow our smart life business and other businesses, while promoting further cost efficiency improvements to reinforce our managerial structure. In addition,
	we have launched &#147;+d&#148; value co-creation initiatives, aiming to deliver new values by making available the business assets that we have accumulated through our operations, such as our payment platform and loyalty program, to a large number
	of external partners. As part of this endeavor, we have rebranded the former &#147;docomo Points Service&#148; program into &#147;d POINT&#148; to offer a point service that is highly convenient and useful for our customers with the aim of expanding
	the structure of the &#147;+d&#148; activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the foregoing, we achieved significant
	improvement in, among other metrics, operating income and operational performance for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016. Furthermore, we were awarded the No. 1 overall ranking in the &#147;2015 Japan Mobile Phone Service Study
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	SM
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#148;* conducted by J.D. Power Asia Pacific.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	38
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, operating revenues increased by &yen;143.7 billion
	from the prior fiscal year to &yen;4,527.1 billion for two reasons, (i) the recovery of our telecommunications business due mainly to an acceleration of users migrating to higher-end plans of &#147;Packet Pack,&#148; data buckets of our new billing
	plan &#147;Kake-hodai &amp; Pake-aeru,&#148; and an expansion in demand for tablets and other products purchased as a second mobile device by individual users and (ii) the growth of our smart life business and other businesses such as
	&#147;dmarket&#148; and other content services. Our operating expenses, on the other hand, decreased by &yen;0.3 billion from the prior fiscal year to &yen;3,744.1 billion, due mainly to decreases in selling expenses and network-related costs as a
	result of cost efficiency improvements, despite an increase in costs associated with increased revenues in our smart life business and other businesses. As a result, our operating income increased by &yen;144.0 billion from the prior fiscal year to
	&yen;783.0 billion. Income before income taxes and equity in net income (losses) of affiliates was &yen;778.0 billion, and net income attributable to NTT DOCOMO, INC. increased by &yen;138.3 billion from the prior fiscal year to &yen;548.4 billion
	for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Going forward, in order to respond to our customers&#146; needs on an ongoing
	basis, we plan to continue to create new added value by moving forward with our &#147;+d&#148; initiatives by further evolving our relationships with various external partners through open collaboration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	The 2015 Japan Mobile Phone Service Study was based on a total of 31,200 responses obtained from mobile phone subscribers in Japan during the survey period in July
	2015.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Market Trend
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the section below, Japan&#146;s telecommunications sector is analyzed from the perspectives of the trends in the market, technical developments/services and regulatory environment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Market
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	According to an announcement by the Telecommunications Carriers Association and cellular network operators, the mobile communications
	market in Japan saw a 3.78&nbsp;million net increase in cellular subscriptions for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016. The total number of cellular subscriptions in Japan grew to 156.48&nbsp;million as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, which
	represented a market penetration rate of approximately 123%. The growth prospect of new subscriptions to voice-enabled devices is expected to be limited given the rise in the penetration rate and decrease in future population. The recent increase in
	the total number of new subscriptions has been driven mainly by an increase in subscriptions achieved through stimulation of demand for secondary devices such as tablet devices and mobile Wi-Fi routers, the development of new markets such as
	embedded communication modules, and an increase in corporate subscriptions. Consequently, the annual growth rate of cellular subscriptions was 5.9%, 6.0% and 2.5% for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, cellular services were provided in Japan by three corporate groups of Mobile Network
	Operators (&#147;MNOs&#148;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*1
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	, including us, and Mobile
	Virtual Network Operators (&#147;MVNOs&#148;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*2
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	that
	provide service by leasing communications facilities from MNOs. In addition to providing cellular services, mobile communications service providers also procure mobile phones and other communications devices compatible with their communications
	services from manufacturers, and subsequently sell them to agent resellers and other retailers for sale to subscribers. As for cellular services, all MNOs in Japan have introduced the LTE
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*3
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	system, a mobile communications standard developed as an extension to the third-generation mobile communications
	(&#147;3G&#148;) system, and the number of LTE subscribers, including users shifting from 3G, has been increasing rapidly. The total number of subscriptions to our LTE(Xi) service reached 38.68 million as of March 31, 2016, increasing sharply from
	30.74 million as of March 31, 2015 and surpassing the total number of our 3G FOMA subscriptions of 32.28 million. In addition, driven by an increase in subscribers to LTE(Xi) services, the sales of smartphones have recorded a remarkable increase in
	recent years.&nbsp;During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, we sold a total of 15.44 million smartphone units. We expect this trend of expanded subscriptions to our LTE(Xi) service and smartphone sales to continue going forward.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	39
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	While the growth prospects for Japan&#146;s mobile phone market may be
	limited in terms of the number of subscriptions to devices used primarily for voice communication, data usage has been increasing owing to the expanded uptake of smartphones, the availability of various billing plans for packet access tailored to
	customers&#146; diverse requirements and the proliferation of high-speed data services. Furthermore, new market opportunities are beginning to emerge in such areas as content and applications for smartphones. Meanwhile, the competition among the
	mobile communications service providers has intensified due to increasing homogeneity in the rate plans, network and handsets offered by the operators, new market entry by MVNOs, and the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications&#146;
	pro-competition policies such as the obligation to unlock handset SIMs. The competitive environment in the Japan&#146;s mobile communications market is also expected to change due to the proposals by the Ministry of Internal Affairs and
	Communications&#146; Task Force on Examining Services from Users&#146; Perspective and Task Force on Mobile Phone Rates and Other Conditions for Service Offerings, and we are watching to see what impact such proposals have on the competitive
	environment. In addition, with the use of open platform devices like smartphones and tablets becoming increasingly widespread, competitive services have been offered by OTT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*4
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	and other players, meaning that the competition in the Japan&#146;s mobile communications market is expected to remain
	fierce.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the domestic fixed-line communications market, NIPPON TELEGRAPH AND TELEPHONE EAST CORPORATION (&#147;NTT
	East&#148;) and NIPPON TELEGRAPH AND TELEPHONE WEST CORPORATION (&#147;NTT West&#148;) started the wholesale of fiber-optic services from February 2015. As this enabled not only telecommunication carriers but also a wide range of other players to
	provide services using optical-fiber connections, competition intensified even further transcending the traditional boundaries of the fixed-line telecommunications market. In March 2015, we launched our &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; optical-fiber
	broadband service and the &#147;docomo Hikari Pack&#148; fixed-mobile bundle package to offer new added value to customers. The total number of &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; subscriptions grew to 1.57 million as of March 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Mobile carriers have also actively entered into or promoted collaborations with other industries, such as the electricity business. As
	carriers start offering package discounts by combining the services offered by players in other industries, price competition is expected to become increasingly fierce.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Amid these changes in the market environment, we commenced a new initiative called &#147;+d&#148; and formed alliances with many partners in an effort to jointly create new values by making available the
	business assets that we have accumulated in our operations to date. As part of this endeavor, we have rebranded the former &#147;docomo Point&#148; program into &#147;d POINT&#148; to offer a point service that is highly convenient and useful for
	our customers with the aim of expanding the foundation of the &#147;+d&#148; activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	A business that provides mobile communications services by establishing or operating its own radio base stations for mobile communications services.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*2
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	A business that borrows the wireless communication infrastructure of other companies to provide services.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*3
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Abbreviation of Long Term Evolution. A mobile communications protocol with specifications formulated by the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (&#147;3GPP&#148;).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*4
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Abbreviation of Over The Top. A business that does not own the communications infrastructure required for delivering their services and that delivers content services
	using the communication infrastructure of other companies.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Technical developments/Services
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The traffic carried by mobile communications networks has increased year after year in line with the expansion in the
	adoption of smartphones, tablets and data devices for PCs and the enrichment of content. To reinforce our network infrastructure, we implemented measures to build up our communications facilities and increase capacity primarily through the use of
	LTE-Advanced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*1
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	technology that offers greater spectral
	efficiency, in order to provide customers with even more stable and comfortable communications quality. By March, 31, 2016, we expanded the coverage of our LTE-Advanced service, known as &#147;PREMIUM 4G,&#148; to 976 cities across Japan. We also
	started offering a maximum downlink speed of 300Mbps in selected areas from October 2015. From March 2016, we commenced the operation of a commercial network that employs network virtualization techniques. The employment allows us to offer
	higher-quality network services to customers, realizing better connectivity in cases of network congestion and higher reliability in the event of the failure of facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	40
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In June 2014, amid intensifying price competition in the mobile communications market, to
	deliver a diverse range of advanced services and to improve the convenience of our subscribers, we began offering a new billing plan, &#147;Kake-hodai &amp; Pake-aeru,&#148; to our subscribers. This new billing plan consists of the four principal
	services of a flat-rate domestic voice calling plan, a plan to enable sharing of the packet data quota among family members, a discount service favoring long-term users with graduated discounts based on length of subscription, and a service
	providing discounts to users age 25 or younger. To cater to low-usage customers, we added new rate options &#147;Kake-hodai Light&#148; in September 2015, and to allow customers to choose more combination with voice calling plans and data plans of
	Packet Pack, we added plans of Packet Pack to be able to combine with &#147;Kake-hodai Light&#148; and &#147;Share Pack 5,&#148; to enable sharing of 5GB data quota among family members, in March 2016. In addition, starting from June 2016, we
	introduced two new options allowing customers to choose subscriptions with or without cancellation fees after completing a two-year contract, &#147;Zutto DOCOMO Wari Course,&#148; under which extra discounts in proportion to subscription period and
	reward points are given to customers who agree to sign another two-year contract, and &#147;Free Course,&#148; in which the basic monthly charge remains unchanged but customers are allowed to cancel their contract at any time without incurring fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	To further increase the uptake of &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; optical-fiber broadband service, starting from March 2016, we
	launched &#147;docomo Hikari Mini,&#148; a two-tier flat-rate plan offering data speeds of up to 100Mbps targeting customers who use broadband connectivity primarily for &#147;Hikari Denwa&#148; IP-telephone service and facsimile transmission but
	not for internet access. We also introduced &#147;Hikari Fukusu Wari&#148; for customers subscribing to more than two lines of &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; for the same share group of a family or company, etc., to allow customers to use our services at
	affordable rates suited to their respective usage conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition to the aforementioned
	endeavors to boost the competitiveness of our telecommunications business, we have also accelerated activities aimed for the growth of our smart life business and other businesses. Specifically, we have strived to increase the service provided on
	our &#147;dmarket&#148; marketplace and enrich the content of our offerings, such as by launching &#147;dgourmet,&#148; a service that provides various recipes and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	food-related
</FONT>
	tips in May 2015. As a
	consequence of such efforts, the combined number of &#147;dmarket&#148; subscriptions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*2
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	reached 15.54 million as of March 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	An advanced mobile communications system standardized by 3GPP that maintains technical compatibility with LTE system.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*2
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	The total number of users using &#147;dTV,&#148; &#147;danime store,&#148; &#147;dhits,&#148;&nbsp;&#147;dkids,&#148; &#147;dmagazine&#148; and &#147;dgourmet&#148;
	services under a monthly subscription arrangement.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Regulatory environment
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We and other MNOs in Japan receive the allocation of radio spectrum from government entities and are subject to regulations under the
	Japanese Telecommunications Business Act, Radio Act and other applicable laws. Japan&#146;s mobile communications industry, in recent years, has seen significant progress in deregulation on many fronts. An amendment to the Telecommunications
	Business Act was enacted in May 2015 and implemented on May 21, 2016, greatly eased the prohibitions that had been applied only to NTT DOCOMO, INC. and such amendment permits NTT DOCOMO, INC. to cooperate freely with various partners in the same way
	other MNOs can. The amendments have also introduced new rules and revisions to existing rules that are intended to protect consumers. The consumer protection policies have applied to all communication businesses, not just us, and each communication
	business has been required to interact with consumers in accordance with such regulations. Further changes in the regulatory environment could significantly affect the revenue structures and business models of incumbent players in the mobile
	communications industry including us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	While, as outlined above, the business environment in which we operate remains tough in
	terms of market conditions, regulations, changes in business models, and other factors, we continue to strive to improve our competitive strength and increase earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	41
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Analysis of operating results for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016 and comparison with the prior fiscal year
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating revenues for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 were &yen;4,527.1 billion, an increase of &yen;143.7&nbsp;billion, or 3.3%, from &yen;4,383.4 billion for the prior fiscal year.
	Telecommunications services revenues for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 were &yen;2,815.5 billion, growing by &yen;68.4 billion, or 2.5%, compared to &yen;2,747.2 billion for the prior fiscal year. Of these, mobile communications services
	revenues increased by
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	42
</FONT>
</P>

</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&yen;30.9&nbsp;billion, or 1.1%, from the &yen;2,736.6 billion for the prior fiscal year, to &yen;2,767.6 billion. Voice revenues decreased by &yen;34.4 billion, or 3.9%, to &yen;849.4 billion
	from &yen;883.8 billion for the prior fiscal year. The decline in voice revenues was due to the expansion of the negative impact from the &#147;Monthly Support&#148; discount program, which exceeded the revenue-boosting effect of subscribers&#146;
	migration to the new billing plan. &#147;Monthly Support&#148; is a program that provides up to 24 months of discounts from monthly service charges, in fixed amounts depending on device purchased, to subscribers using devices such as smartphones and
	tablets whose subscriptions satisfy certain conditions. Packet communications revenues for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 recorded an increase of &yen;65.3 billion, or 3.5%, to &yen;1,918.2 billion from &yen;1,852.8 billion for the prior
	fiscal year. This growth was attributable to the positive revenue impact associated with the heightened demand for a secondary mobile device as a result of improving our product lineup of tablet devices and sales promotion efforts, and
	subscribers&#146; migration to larger data buckets of our billing plan &#147;Kake-hodai and Pake-aeru.&#148; The total number of LTE(Xi) service subscriptions as of March 31, 2016 grew to 38.68 million, and the total number of smartphones sold
	during the 12-month period through March 31, 2016 reached 15.44 million units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Optical-fiber broadband services and other
	telecommunications services revenues for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 were &yen;47.9 billion, an increase of by &yen;37.4 billion, or 356.1%, from &yen;10.5 billion for the prior fiscal year, driven by the significant growth in the number of
	subscriptions to the &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; optical-fiber broadband service launched in March 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result, voice
	ARPU for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 dropped &yen;70, or 5.5%, to &yen;1,210 from &yen;1,280 for the prior fiscal year. Packet ARPU for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 was &yen;2,910, up &yen;90, or 3.2%, from &yen;2,820 for the prior
	fiscal year. &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; ARPU for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 was &yen;50. We launched our &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; optical-fiber broadband service in March 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Equipment sales revenues decreased by &yen;43.6 billion, or 4.8%, to &yen;860.5 billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 from
	&yen;904.1 billion for the prior fiscal year, because, although the proportion of smartphones and tablet devices, which carry a higher unit price, to the total number of handset sold increased, the total number of handsets sold to agent resellers
	recorded a decline.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other operating revenues increased by &yen;118.9 billion, or 16.2%, from &yen;732.2 billion for the prior
	fiscal year to &yen;851.1 billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&nbsp;The primary items comprising other operating revenues include revenues derived from shopping service, services to support our customers&#146; daily lives, &#147;Mobile
	Device Protection Service,&#148; services offered through our &#147;dmarket&#148; portal and credit services. The increase was driven mainly by the increased revenues from &#147;Mobile Device Protection Service&#148; due to growth in the number of
	protection contracts, increased revenues from the &#147;Sugotoku-Contents&#148; services due to growth in the number of subscribers, increased revenues from &#147;dmarket&#148; resulting from an increase in subscribers of monthly subscription
	services in &#147;dmarket,&#148; the growth of transaction amount handled by our credit services including &#147;d&nbsp;CARD&#148; credit services and a rise of revenues from sales of mobile phone accessories.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating expenses decreased by &yen;0.3 billion from &yen;3,744.3 billion for the prior fiscal year to &yen;3,744.1&nbsp;billion for the
	fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Cost of services, which represents the expenses we incur directly in connection with
	providing our customers with mobile communications services and/or other services offered by our subsidiaries, increased by &yen;89.0 billion, or 7.7%, from &yen;1,159.5 billion for the prior fiscal year to &yen;1,248.6 billion for the fiscal year
	ended March 31, 2016, resulting from increased cost of services associated with the revenue expansion in new growth areas such as &#147;docomo Hikari,&#148; &#147;dmarket&#148; and the &#147;Mobile Device Protection Service.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Cost of equipment sold, which arises mainly from our procurement of handsets for sale to our new or current subscribers through agent
	resellers, increased by &yen;28.4 billion, or 3.3%, to &yen;881.5 billion from &yen;853.1&nbsp;billion for the prior fiscal year primarily as a result of increased proportion of smartphones and tablets, whose procurement costs per unit are higher
	than for feature phones, to our total handset sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	43
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage46"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Depreciation and amortization expenses decreased by &yen;33.9 billion, or 5.1%, to
	&yen;625.9 billion from &yen;659.8&nbsp;billion for the prior fiscal year, due to the decrease in depreciable and amortizable assets resulting from the cost efficiency improvement measures implemented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Selling, general and administrative expenses decreased by &yen;62.8 billion, or 6.0%, to &yen;979.0 billion from &yen;1,041.8 billion for
	the prior fiscal year. The primary components included in our selling, general and administrative expenses are expenses related to the acquisition of new subscribers and retention of current subscribers, which includes commissions paid to agent
	resellers and the expenses incurred in relation to &#147;dPOINT&#148; and &#147;docomo Point Service&#148; customer loyalty program. The decline in selling, general and administrative expenses was due mainly to decreases in expenses incurred in
	relation to &#147;d POINT&#148; and &#147;docomo Point Service,&#148; expenses for collection of bills and commissions paid to agent resellers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Impairment loss totaled &yen;9.1 billion, posting a decline of &yen;21.1 billion, or 70.0%, from &yen;30.2 billion for the prior fiscal year. We reduced the carrying value of long-lived assets related to
	multimedia broadcasting business for mobile devices to their fair value in the prior fiscal year. The impairment loss recorded in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 was related primarily to the impairment of long-lived assets related to multimedia
	broadcasting business for mobile devices assets that we acquired during the same year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As described above, operating expenses
	for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 remained nearly unchanged from the prior fiscal year, as the increase in cost of services and cost of equipment sold was cancelled out by the decline in depreciation and amortization expenses, impairment loss
	and selling, general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the foregoing, operating income for the fiscal year ended
	March 31, 2016 increased by &yen;144.0&nbsp;billion, or 22.5%, from &yen;639.1 billion for the prior fiscal year to &yen;783.0 billion. Accordingly, our operating income margin improved from 14.6% for the prior fiscal year to 17.3%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other income (expense) includes items such as interest expense, interest income, dividend income, foreign exchange gains and losses and
	other-than-temporary impairment losses and net realized gains (losses) on dispositions of marketable securities and other investments. We recognized &yen;5.0 billion as other expense, net for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, after recording
	other income of &yen;4.8 billion in the prior fiscal year. This was due mainly to &yen;13.1 billion in losses incurred from the disposition of a consolidated subsidiary during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the foregoing, income before income taxes and equity in net income (losses) of affiliates increased by &yen;134.1 billion,
	or 20.8%, to &yen;778.0 billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 from &yen;643.9&nbsp;billion for the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Income taxes decreased by &yen;26.3 billion, or 11.1%, from &yen;238.1 billion for the prior fiscal year to &yen;211.7&nbsp;billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016. This was because the impact of
	release of valuation allowances for consolidated subsidiaries engaged in multimedia broadcasting business for mobile devices and the impact of decline in aggregate statutory income tax rate for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 compared to the
	tax rate for the prior fiscal year outweighed the impact from the increase in income before income taxes and equity in net income (losses) of affiliates. The effective income tax rate for the fiscal years ended March 31, 2016 and 2015 was 27.2% and
	37.0%, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For equity in net income (losses) of affiliates, our equity in the net losses of our affiliates
	decreased by &yen;2.7&nbsp;billion, or 35.0%, to &yen;5.1 billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 from &yen;7.8 billion for the prior fiscal year. For each of the fiscal years ended March 31, 2016 and 2015, the equity in losses of certain
	affiliates including Tata Teleservices Limited (&#147;TTSL&#148;) was offset by the equity in income of other affiliates including Sumitomo Mitsui Card Co., Ltd. and Philippine Long Distance Telephone Company (&#147;PLDT&#148;). The primary reason
	behind the decrease in equity in net losses of affiliates for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 was the decrease in the equity loss of TTSL as compared to the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	44
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage47"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the foregoing, we reported &yen;548.4 billion in net income attributable to
	NTT DOCOMO, INC., representing an increase of &yen;138.3 billion, or 33.7%, from &yen;410.1 billion for the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_13"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Definition of ARPU
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Aggregate&nbsp;ARPU:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Voice ARPU + Packet ARPU + &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; ARPU
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Voice ARPU:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Voice ARPU Related Revenues (basic monthly usage charges, voice communication charges) / number&nbsp;of active users
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Data ARPU:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Packet ARPU + &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; ARPU
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Packet ARPU:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Packet ARPU Related Revenues (basic monthly usage charges, packet communication charges) / number&nbsp;of active users
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	&#147;docomo&nbsp;Hikari&#148;&nbsp;ARPU:&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	A part of other operating revenues (basic monthly usage charges, voice communication charges) / number of active users
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Number&nbsp;of active users used in ARPU calculations is as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Sum of number&nbsp;of active users for each month
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
	during the relevant period from April to
	March
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*&nbsp;&nbsp;Active users for each month = (number&nbsp;of users at the end of previous month + number&nbsp;of users at the end of current month) / 2
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	The number of &#147;users&#148; used to calculate ARPU and MOU is the total number of subscriptions, excluding the
	subscriptions listed below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	a.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Subscriptions of communication module services, &#147;Phone Number Storage,&#148; &#147;Mail Address Storage,&#148; &#147;docomo Business Transceiver&#148; and
	wholesale telecommunications services and interconnecting telecommunications facilities that are provided to Mobile Virtual Network Operators (MVNOs); and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	b.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Data Plan subscriptions in the case where the customer contracting for such subscription in his/her name also has a subscription for &#147;Xi&#148; or &#147;FOMA&#148;
	services in his/her name.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*2
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	With the introduction of &#147;Optical-fiber service and other telecommunications service revenues&#148; in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, some elements
	(revenues from satellite mobile communications, cable television of overseas and other services) included in conventional &#147;Other operating revenues&#148; in the financial statements for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 have been
	retroactively reclassified into &#147;Optical-fiber broadband service and other telecommunications services revenues.&#148; The amount of the reclassification was &yen;8,192&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	46
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage49"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Analysis of operating results for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2015 and comparison with the prior
	fiscal year
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating revenues for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, were &yen;4,383.4 billion, a decrease of
	&yen;77.8&nbsp;billion, or 1.7%, from &yen;4,461.2 billion for the prior fiscal year. Telecommunications services revenues were &yen;2,747.2 billion, decreasing by &yen;216.8 billion, or 7.3%, compared to &yen;2,964.0 billion for the prior fiscal
	year. Of these, mobile communications services revenues decreased by &yen;219.1 billion, or 7.4%, from the previous year&#146;s figure of &yen;2,955.8 billion, to &yen;2,736.6 billion. Voice revenues decreased by &yen;181.4 billion, or 17.0%, year
	on year to &yen;883.8 billion from &yen;1,065.2 billion for the prior fiscal year. The decline in voice revenues includes the expanded impact of the &#147;Monthly Support&#148; discounts of &yen;73.1 billion as compared to the prior fiscal year and
	the impact of the shift of some FOMA users to lower-rate plans. &#147;Monthly Support&#148; is a service that provides up to 24 months of discounts from monthly service charges, in fixed amounts depending on device purchased, to subscribers using
	devices such as smartphones and tablets whose subscriptions satisfy certain conditions. Packet communications revenues recorded a decrease of &yen;37.8 billion, or 2.0%, to &yen;1,852.8&nbsp;billion from &yen;1,890.6 billion for the prior fiscal
	year. This decrease was due to the fact that the positive effects on revenues from the increase in LTE(Xi) service subscribers and aggressive sales promotion of smartphones and other devices were outweighed by the negative effects on revenues of the
	expanded impact of &#147;Monthly Support&#148; discounts and the negative impact caused by our new billing plan in the initial phase following its launch because the migration of our customers to the plan grew faster than expected. The negative
	impact on revenue due to the expanded &#147;Monthly Support&#148; discounts was &yen;43.9 billion as compared to the prior fiscal year. The total number of LTE(Xi)&nbsp;service subscriptions as of March 31, 2015 grew to 30.74 million, and the total
	number of smartphones sold during the 12-month period through March 31, 2015 reached 14.60 million. As a result, the voice ARPU for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 dropped &yen;210, or 14.1%, to &yen;1,280 from &yen;1,490 for the prior fiscal
	year. The packet ARPU for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 was &yen;2,820, down &yen;60, or 2.1%, from &yen;2,880 for the prior fiscal year. Optical-fiber broadband service and other telecommunications services revenues increased by &yen;2.3
	billion, or 28.2%, from &yen;8.2 billion in the prior fiscal year to &yen;10.5 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Equipment sales revenues increased by &yen;32.1 billion, or 3.7%, to &yen;904.1 billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 from
	&yen;872.0 billion for the prior fiscal year, due to increased sales resulting from addition of new subscribers of devices, including smartphones, stimulation of demand for second devices through enhancement of the lineup of tablet devices and
	introduction of the new billing plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other operating revenues increased by &yen;106.9 billion, or 17.1%, from &yen;625.2
	billion for the prior fiscal year to &yen;732.2 billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&nbsp;The primary items comprising other operating revenues include revenues derived from shopping service, services to support our customers&#146;
	daily lives, &#147;Mobile&nbsp;Device Protection Service,&#148; services offered through &#147;dmarket&#148; portal, and credit services. The increase was driven mainly by the full-year consolidation of sales revenues from ABC Cooking Studio Co.,
	Ltd., a subsidiary that we acquired in January 2014, in order to expand the smart life business, increased revenues from &#147;Mobile Device Protection Service&#148; due to growth in the number of protection contracts, and increased revenues from
	&#147;dmarket&#148; resulting from an increase in subscribers of monthly subscription services in &#147;dmarket&#148; and an increase in sales of pay-per-view or -use content services of &#147;dmarket.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating expenses increased by &yen;102.3 billion, or 2.8%, from &yen;3,642.0 billion for the prior fiscal year to &yen;3,744.3 billion
	for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Cost of services, which represents the expenses we incur directly in connection
	with providing our customers with mobile communications services and/or other services offered by our subsidiaries, increased by &yen;99.9 billion, or 9.4%, from &yen;1,059.6 billion for the prior fiscal year to &yen;1,159.5 billion for the fiscal
	year ended March 31, 2015, resulting from increased cost of services associated with increased revenues in the smart life business and other businesses, including the full-year consolidation of sales revenue from ABC Cooking Studio Co., Ltd., and an
	increase in charges for use of other companies&#146; telecommunications equipment in connection with a significant increase in the number of installations of LTE base stations in order to build a robust network.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	47
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage50"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Cost of equipment sold, which arises mainly from our procurement of handsets for sale to our
	new or current subscribers through agent resellers, increased by &yen;67.9 billion, or 8.6%, to &yen;853.1 billion from &yen;785.2&nbsp;billion for the prior fiscal year primarily as a result of strong sales of smartphones and tablets, whose
	procurement costs per unit are higher than for feature phone.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Depreciation and amortization expenses decreased by &yen;58.9
	billion, or 8.2%, to &yen;659.8 billion from &yen;718.7&nbsp;billion for the prior fiscal year, resulting from the effects of a revision in the estimate of the expected useful life of certain software for telecommunications network and internal-use
	software as well as the effects of reduction in capital expenditures as a result of cost efficiency improvements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Selling,
	general and administrative expenses decreased by &yen;36.7 billion, or 3.4%, to &yen;1,041.8 billion from &yen;1,078.5 billion for prior fiscal year. The primary components included in our selling, general and administrative expenses are expenses
	related to the acquisition of new subscribers and retention of current subscribers, which includes commissions paid to agent resellers and the expenses incurred in relation to &#147;docomo Points Service&#148; customer loyalty program. The decline
	of selling, general and administrative expenses was due mainly to a decrease of &yen;41.9 billion in commissions paid to agent resellers, offsetting an increase in advertising expenses of &yen;3.6 billion in connection with the introduction of the
	new billing plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Impairment loss totaled &yen;30.2 billion, due to reduction of the carrying value of multimedia
	broadcasting business for mobile devices assets to their fair value during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As described
	above, the increases in operating expenses other than selling, general and administrative expenses, and depreciation and amortization expenses exceeded the decreases in selling, general and administrative expenses, and depreciation and amortization
	expenses, which resulted in an increase in operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the foregoing, operating income for the fiscal
	year ended March 31, 2015 decreased by &yen;180.1&nbsp;billion, or 22.0%, from &yen;819.2 billion for the prior fiscal year to &yen;639.1 billion. Accordingly, the operating income margin dropped from 18.4% for the prior fiscal year to 14.6%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other income (expense) includes items such as interest expense, interest income, dividend income, foreign exchange gains and
	losses and other-than-temporary impairment losses and net realized gains (losses) on dispositions of marketable securities and other investments. We recognized &yen;4.8 billion as other income, net for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015,
	reflecting a decrease of &yen;9.0 billion, or 65.3%, from the figure of &yen;13.9&nbsp;billion in the prior fiscal year. This was due mainly to the fact that net realized gains (losses) on dispositions of investments in affiliates and of marketable
	securities and other investments decreased from net realized gains of &yen;3.7 billion to net realized losses of &yen;0.2 billion from the prior fiscal year and the fact that foreign exchange gains, net, which totaled &yen;4.4 billion in the prior
	fiscal year, fell to foreign exchange losses, net, of &yen;0.4 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result,
	income before income taxes and equity in net income (losses) of affiliates decreased by &yen;189.2&nbsp;billion, or 22.7%, to &yen;643.9 billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 from &yen;833.0 billion for the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Income taxes decreased by &yen;69.9 billion or 22.7% from &yen;308.0 billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to &yen;238.1
	billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, resulting from a decrease in income before income taxes and equity in net income (losses) of affiliates. An effective income tax rate in both fiscal years is 37.0%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For equity in net income (losses) of affiliates, our equity in the net losses of our affiliates decreased by &yen;61.3 billion, or 88.7%,
	to &yen;7.8 billion for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 from &yen;69.1 billion for the prior fiscal year. For both the fiscal years, the equity in losses of certain affiliates including Tata Teleservices Limited
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	48
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage51"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(&#147;TTSL&#148;) was offsetting against the equity in income of other affiliates including Sumitomo Mitsui Card Co., Ltd. and Philippine Long Distance Telephone Company (&#147;PLDT&#148;). For
	the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, the equity loss of TTSL decreased from the previous year due mainly to the fact that an additional impairment charge on TTSL amounting to &yen;51.2 billion had been recorded in the prior fiscal year but was not
	recorded for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015. See Note 6 concerning financial information for TTSL.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the
	foregoing, we reported &yen;410.1 billion in net income attributable to NTT DOCOMO, INC. for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, representing a decrease of &yen;54.6 billion, or 11.8%, from &yen;464.7 billion for the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_15"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Key Performance Indicators
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The underlying operational data for the above-mentioned financial results for the fiscal years ended March&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 are provided below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="68%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="14" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	Years ended March&nbsp;31
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	2014
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Definition of ARPU
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Aggregate&nbsp;ARPU:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Voice ARPU + Packet ARPU + &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; Smart ARPU
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Voice ARPU:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Voice ARPU Related Revenues (basic monthly usage charges, voice communication charges) / number of active users
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Data ARPU:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Packet ARPU + &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; ARPU
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Packet ARPU:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Packet ARPU Related Revenues (basic monthly usage charges, packet communication charges) / number of active users
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	&#147;docomo&nbsp;Hikari&#148;&nbsp;ARPU:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	docomo Hikari ARPU Related Revenues (basic monthly usage charges, voice communication charges) / number of active user
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Number of active users used in ARPU calculations is as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Sum of number of active users for each month
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
	during the relevant period from April to
	March
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*&nbsp;&nbsp;Active users for each month = (number&nbsp;of users at the end of previous month + number&nbsp;of users at the end of current month) / 2
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	49
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage52"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D140692D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	The number of &#147;users&#148; used to calculate ARPU and MOU is the total number of subscriptions,
	excluding the subscriptions listed below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	a.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Subscriptions of communication module services, &#147;Phone Number Storage,&#148; &#147;Mail Address Storage,&#148; &#147;docomo Business Transceiver&#148; and
	wholesale telecommunications services and interconnecting telecommunications facilities that are provided to Mobile Virtual Network Operators (MVNOs); and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	b.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Data Plan subscriptions in the case where the customer contracting for such subscription in his/her name also has a subscription for &#147;Xi&#148; or &#147;FOMA&#148;
	services in his/her name.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Segment Information
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	General
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We report the individual results of our three business
	segments, which consists of telecommunications business, smart life business and other businesses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The telecommunications
	business segment includes mobile phone services (LTE(Xi) services and FOMA services), optical-fiber broadband service, satellite mobile communications services, international services and equipment sales related to these services. The smart life
	business segment includes video and music distribution, electronic books and other services offered through our &#147;dmarket&#148; portal, as well as finance/payment services, shopping services and various other services to support our
	customers&#146; daily lives. The other businesses segment primarily includes &#147;Mobile Device Protection Service,&#148; as well as development, sales and maintenance of IT systems.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Telecommunications business
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating revenues in the telecommunications business segment are mainly derived from telecommunications
	services and equipment sales. For the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016, operating revenues from our telecommunications business segment increased by &yen;35.2 billion, or 1.0%, to &yen;3,689.8 billion from &yen;3,654.6 billion for the prior
	fiscal year. Telecommunications services revenues recorded an increase of &yen;63.0&nbsp;billion, or 2.3%, to &yen;2,777.5 billion from &yen;2,714.4 billion in the prior fiscal year. Mobile communications service revenues, a part of
	telecommunications services revenues consisting of voice revenues and packet communications revenues, grew by &yen;25.4 billion, or 0.9%, in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 to &yen;2,729.8&nbsp;billion from &yen;2,704.4 billion in the prior
	fiscal year. The increase in mobile communications services revenues in the telecommunications business was due primarily to the revenue-boosting effects of increased data (packet) usage of customers owning multiple mobile devices as a result of our
	improved tablet device lineup and sale promotion efforts and subscribers&#146; migration to relatively higher-end rate plans of our billing plan
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	&#147;Kake-hodai
</FONT>
	and Pake-aeru,&#148; which more than offset the
	negative impact of the expanded application of &#147;Monthly Support&#148; discounts and the decrease in revenues caused by the introduction of &#147;Kake-hodai Light&#148; rate plans. In addition, optical-fiber broadband service and other
	telecommunications services revenues, which represent revenues from optical-fiber broadband service, satellite communications services, overseas cable television services, and other sources, increased by &yen;37.6 billion, or 376.8%, to &yen;47.6
	billion from &yen;10.0 billion in the prior fiscal year. The principal driver behind this growth was the introduction, in March 2015, of our &#147;docomo Hikari&#148; optical-fiber broadband service, which reached 1.57 million subscription as of
	March 31, 2016.&nbsp;Revenues from equipment sales, on the other hand, decreased by &yen;44.1 billion, or 4.9%, to &yen;856.6 billion
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	50
</FONT>
</P>
